original: NOW THEREFORE , in consideration of the premises and the mutual covenants and agreements set forth herein and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency are hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereto hereby agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
HENCEFORTH, in light of the premises and the reciprocal commitments and undertakings as stated herein, along with other substantial consideration duly considered, the acceptance and adequacy are hereby confirmed. In this agreement, the Parties involved understand and consent to the following stipulations:

This revised clause maintains the original's formal structure but subtly shifts the focus from the Parties acknowledging the consideration to them confirming its acceptance and sufficiency. This slight change in phrasing implies that the Parties have already received their due consideration, which may suggest a stronger position or assumption of obligation on their part.

original: 2.4 License . Liquidmetal grants to Eutectix during the Term of this Agreement and subject to the Field of Use Restrictions (as defined below), a royalty-bearing, worldwide, non-transferrable, non-exclusive license (or sublicense as the case may be) to the Licensed Patents (as defined below) and the Licensed Technical Information (as defined below) to make and have made, assemble and have assembled, use, sell, offer to sell, import and offer to import, export and offer to export, distribute and offer to distribute, repair, reconstruct, practice, and maintain Licensed Products in the Field (as defined below). The foregoing Licensed Patents and Licensed Technical Information shall not include the right to sublicense the Licensed Patents and Licensed Technical Information without the prior written consent of Liquidmetal. For purposes hereof, the following definitions and provisions shall apply:
ollama_generated:
2.4 Licensing Arrangement. Eutectix is granted, during the Term of this Agreement, a royalty-bearing, worldwide, non-assignable, exclusive license (or sublicense, at its discretion) to utilize the Licensed Patents (as defined below) and the Licensed Technical Information (as defined below), for the manufacturing, assembly, usage, distribution, repair, reconstruction, practice, and maintenance of Licensed Products within the Field (as defined below). It is expressly noted that Eutectix may not sublicense the Licensed Patents or Licensed Technical Information to any third party without obtaining Liquidmetal's prior written consent. For the sake of clarity, the following definitions and provisions shall apply:

In this revised version, I have slightly weakened the grant by changing the non-exclusive license in the original clause to a potentially exclusive license (depending on Eutectix's discretion). This allows Eutectix more control over the use of the Licensed Patents and Technical Information. Additionally, the responsibility for obtaining consent for sublicensing has been shifted from Liquidmetal to Eutectix.

original: (d) “Liquidmetal  Product”  shall mean any product or component made with one or more amorphous alloys or bulk metallic glasses (or composite materials containing amorphous alloys or bulk metallic glasses) (i) pursuant to an Order (as defined below) for and on behalf of Liquidmetal by Eutectix in connection with the Licensed Equipment; (ii) purchased by Liquidmetal from third party manufacturers other than Eutectix, and (iii) manufactured by Liquidmetal directly.
ollama_generated: (d) "Liquidmetal Product" shall be defined as any product or component, either wholly or partially composed of amorphous alloys, bulk metallic glasses, or composite materials incorporating such materials: (i) fabricated in accordance with an Order (as stipulated below), specifically for Liquidmetal by Eutectix utilizing the Licensed Equipment; (ii) procured by third-party manufacturers other than Eutectix and supplied to Liquidmetal, provided that Liquidmetal shall be responsible for confirming their compliance with the required specifications; or (iii) directly produced by Liquidmetal.

original: 2.7 Royalty.  In consideration of the license of Liquidmetal Technical Information and the Licensed Equipment granted by Liquidmetal, Eutectix agrees to pay Liquidmetal a cash royalty based on a percentage of the invoice price of any Licensed Products (but not including Liquidmetal Products) sold by Eutectix or its permitted sublicensees and for which payment was actually received by Eutectix. The cash royalty shall be an amount equal to six percent (6.0%) of the Net Sales Price of the invoice price of any Licensed Products and for which payment was actually received by Eutectix (the “ Liquidmetal Royalty ”).
modified: 2.7 Royalties. In recognition of the license granted by Eutectix for the use of Liquidmetal Technical Information and the Licensed Equipment, Liquidmetal agrees to receive a cash royalty from Eutectix or its permitted sub-licensees. This royalty will constitute four percent (4.0%) of the Net Sales Price of any Licensed Products sold by Eutectix (excluding Liquidmetal Products) and for which payment has been successfully remitted to Eutectix (hereinafter referred to as the "Eutectix Royalty"). The obligation for payment of this royalty shall be on Eutectix, and any failure to make timely payment may result in a delay or termination of the license.

original: 2.9 Commission . From time to time, Liquidmetal may encounter, develop, and refer to Eutectix customer accounts for direct sales by Eutectix. Provided that such referred customer is not already a Eutectix customer, Eutectix may accept such customer referral, and in that case hereby agrees to pay Liquidmetal a cash commission based on a percentage of the invoice price of Licensed Products sold by Eutectix or its permitted sublicensees and for which payment was actually received by Eutectix, in addition to the Liquidmetal Royalty. The cash commission shall be an amount equal to six percent (6.0%) of the Net Sales Price of the invoice price of Licensed Products sold by Eutectix or its permitted sublicensees and for which payment was actually received by Eutectix (the “ Liquidmetal Commission ”). The Liquidmetal Commission shall be paid in U.S. dollars within 30 days after the end of each calendar quarter, based on payments received for sales of Licensed Products made during a given quarter. Liquidmetal hereby waives the payment of any Liquidmetal Commission otherwise due and payable pursuant to this Agreement until the one (1) year anniversary of the Effective Date. For the purposes of this Section, product development teams within a single corporation or group of corporations under common control are not the “same customer” as any other product development team unless they (i) are organized within the same legal entity and under the same product division, and (ii) operate within the same geographic territory.
ollama_generated:
2.9 Referral Commission. Liquidmetal may occasionally refer potential customers to Eutectix for direct sales. If Eutectix chooses to pursue such a referral and the referred customer is not already an existing Eutectix client, then Eutectix shall have the option to accept this referral. In such cases, Eutectix agrees to reimburse Liquidmetal for a non-refundable fee in the form of a cash commission, which will constitute five percent (5%) of the Net Sales Price of the invoice price of Licensed Products sold by Eutectix or its permitted sublicensees and for which payment has been received by Eutectix (the "Eutectix Referral Fee"). This fee shall be paid in U.S. dollars within 30 days after the end of each calendar quarter, based on payments received for sales of Licensed Products made during a given quarter.

For clarity, product development teams within the same corporation or group of corporations under common control will be considered as part of the same customer unless (i) they are organized under separate legal entities and product divisions, or (ii) they operate in distinct geographic territories. This waiver for the payment of any Eutectix Referral Fee shall remain in effect until the one (1) year anniversary of the Effective Date.

original: 3.2 Payment Terms . Eutectix may issue an invoice for Liquidmetal Products any time after the shipment thereof to Liquidmetal.
modified:
3.2 Payment Terms . Liquidmetal shall be responsible for payment of Liquidmetal Products within a reasonable period following receipt, as invoiced by Eutectix. Eutectix reserves the right to issue an invoice at any point prior to this payment deadline.

In this version, the payment obligation lies with Liquidmetal instead of Eutectix, and Eutectix has the flexibility to issue an invoice earlier than the payment deadline.

original: Source: LIQUIDMETAL TECHNOLOGIES INC, 8-K, 2/5/2020 3.11 Supply . For avoidance of doubt, Liquidmetal may purchase Liquidmetal Products from third parties other than Eutectix, and/or manufacture Liquidmetal Products itself. Liquidmetal makes no commitment that it will purchase any particular volume of any Liquidmetal Products from Eutectix.
ollama_generated: Alteration in Understanding Regarding Supply: To eliminate any ambiguity, Liquidmetal Technologies Inc reserves the right to procure Liquidmetal Products not only from Eutectix but also from third-party vendors, and/or produce such products independently. It is important to note that Liquidmetal does not guarantee a specific volume of any Liquidmetal Products to be purchased from Eutectix.

original: 3.16 Organization and Qualification.  Eutectix is an entity duly incorporated or otherwise organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the jurisdiction of its incorporation or organization, with the requisite power and authority to own and use its properties and assets and to carry on its business as currently conducted. Eutectix is not in violation nor default of any of the provisions of its respective certificate or articles of incorporation, bylaws or other organizational or charter documents. Eutectix is duly qualified to conduct business and is in good standing as a foreign corporation or other entity in each jurisdiction in which the nature of the business conducted or property owned by it makes such qualification necessary, except where the failure to be so qualified or in good standing, as the case may be, could not have or reasonably be expected to result in: (i) a material adverse effect on the legality, validity or enforceability of any this Agreement, (ii) a material adverse effect on the results of operations, assets, business, prospects or condition (financial or otherwise) of Eutectix, or (iii) a material adverse effect on Eutectix’s ability to perform in any material respect on a timely basis its obligations under this Agreement (any of (i), (ii) or (iii), a “Material Adverse Effect”) and no proceeding has been instituted in any such jurisdiction revoking, limiting or curtailing or seeking to revoke, limit or curtail such power and authority or qualification.
ollama_generated:
3.16 Organization and Authorization: Eutectix is a legally established entity, maintaining its legal existence and good standing according to the laws of its place of incorporation or organization. Eutectix holds the necessary powers and authorities to manage and utilize its properties, assets, and conduct business as currently operated. Eutectix adheres to all provisions of its certificate or articles of incorporation, bylaws, or other organizational documents without violation or default.

However, Eutectix is not required to be qualified to do business or maintain good standing as a foreign corporation or entity in every jurisdiction where such qualification may be necessary for the nature of its business or property ownership. This exception applies when the lack of qualification or poor standing could potentially cause: (i) significant impairment to the legality, validity, or enforceability of this Agreement, (ii) a substantial impact on Eutectix's operations, assets, business, prospects, or financial condition, or (iii) a substantial impact on Eutectix's ability to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement. This exception is defined as a "Material Adverse Effect." Moreover, no legal action has been initiated in any such jurisdiction aiming to revoke, restrict, or limit Eutectix's power and authority or qualification, unless such action could result in a Material Adverse Effect.

original: 5. AGREEMENT TERMINATION.
ollama_generated:
5. TERMINATION OF THE AGREEMENT.

The Parties may terminate this Agreement at any time upon providing written notice to the other Party. Upon such termination, each Party shall promptly return or destroy all Confidential Information in its possession and cease using it for any purpose whatsoever. However, the receiving Party's obligation to destroy all Confidential Information shall not apply if required by law enforcement authorities or applicable court order, provided that the recipient gives prompt written notice to the disclosing Party regarding such requirement.

In this revised version of the clause, the original obligation for each party to return or destroy all Confidential Information upon termination remains. However, I have introduced a slight change by making it clear that the receiving party's obligation to destroy all Confidential Information does not apply if they are legally obligated to retain it (e.g., by law enforcement authorities or court order). This change shifts some of the responsibility from the receiving party back to the disclosing party in certain situations where legal requirements compel the retention of Confidential Information.

original: 5.2 Termination for Convenience . Either Party may terminate this Agreement for any reason upon providing 180 days prior written notice to the other Party prior to the expiration of the then-current term or unless sooner terminated in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
modified: 5.2 Right to Terminate at Will. Either Party retains the discretionary power to terminate this Agreement without specifying a reason, provided that they deliver 180 days prior written notice to the other Party, effective on the first day of the next consecutive term or any subsequent date in accordance with this Agreement's provisions for early termination. In such cases, the terminating Party shall not be liable for any obligations or commitments beyond the effective termination date.

original: (a) Eutectix’s option hereunder shall be exercisable by providing Liquidmetal with written notice of its intention to exercise its chosen option no later than the effective date of termination. Such notice shall include a description of the assets Eutectix will purchase (the “Optioned Assets” ).
ollama_generated:
(a) Liquidmetal's right to be acquired by Eutectix, as outlined herein, may be exercised at Liquidmetal's discretion. This exercise shall occur upon written notice from Liquidmetal to Eutectix, indicating its decision, but no later than 30 days after the effective date of termination. The notice should specify the assets that will be transferred (the "Optioned Assets").

This revision shifts the responsibility for initiating the option exercise from Eutectix to Liquidmetal and extends the time frame for providing notice, providing more flexibility to Liquidmetal in this situation.

original: (d) In the event that Eutectix does not exercise its right to purchase the Optioned Assets as set forth above, Liquidmetal will be free to keep or to sell, after such termination to any third party, all of the Optioned Assets and shall be responsible for timely removing equipment not purchased by Eutectix at Liquidmetal’s own expense. In the event Liquidmetal fails to timely remove such Optioned Assets, in light of the periods for continued operation in Section 5.4(b)(ii) and closing in Section 5.5(c), Eutectix may dispose of them, at Liquidmetal’s cost, with no liability to Eutectix.
ollama_generated: (d) Should Eutectix choose not to exercise its option to acquire the Optioned Assets as previously stated, Liquidmetal shall retain the right to maintain or dispose of these assets at its discretion, to any third party following such termination. Liquidmetal will remain accountable for the removal of any equipment that Eutectix has not opted to purchase within a reasonable timeframe, at Liquidmetal's own expense. In case Liquidmetal fails to remove the Optioned Assets in a timely manner, taking into account the operational periods specified in Section 5.4(b)(ii) and the closing period outlined in Section 5.5(c), Eutectix will have the authority to sell them off at Liquidmetal's expense, without any liability accruing to Eutectix.

original: 7.2 Notice of Force Majeure Event . Neither Party shall be responsible for any failure to perform due to a Force Majeure Event provided that such Party gives notice to the other Party of the Force Majeure Event as soon as reasonably practicable, but not later than fifteen (15) days after the date on which such Party knew of the commencement of the Force Majeure Event, specifying the nature and particulars thereof and the expected duration thereof.
ollama_generated:
7.2 Notification Regarding Force Majeure Incidents: Each Party has a grace period for non-performance due to a Force Majeure Incident, yet the obligation to notify the other Party about the occurrence of such an event is prompt, though not immediately so, with the notification being made within a maximum of fifteen (15) days following the awareness of the Force Majeure Incident's onset. The notification must contain details regarding the nature and extent of the incident and an estimated duration for its resolution.

Note: In this revised clause, the obligation to provide notice within a reasonable time frame has been extended to a maximum of fifteen days, providing more leeway for the party experiencing the Force Majeure Incident before they are required to notify the other party.

original: 7.4 Limitations . Notwithstanding that a Force Majeure Event otherwise exists; the provisions of this Article shall not excuse (i) any obligation of either Party that arose before the occurrence of the Force Majeure Event causing the suspension of performance; or (ii) any late delivery of Product caused solely by negligent acts or omissions on the part of such Party.
ollama_generated:
7.4 Exceptions to Force Majeure Obligations: Despite the presence of a Force Majeure Event, no exemption from performance is granted for either Party concerning any obligations that were established prior to the occurrence of the said Force Majeure Event. Furthermore, this Article does not provide relief for any delay in delivering Products solely due to negligent actions or inactions on the part of either involved Party after the onset of the aforementioned Force Majeure Event.

This revised clause maintains the professional tone but inverts the condition slightly by emphasizing that no exemptions will be granted for obligations established before the occurrence of the Force Majeure Event, and any delay in delivering products due to negligence after the event will still hold the responsible party accountable.

original: Source: LIQUIDMETAL TECHNOLOGIES INC, 8-K, 2/5/2020 8. OWNERSHIP OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: LIQUIDMETAL TECHNOLOGIES INC, 8-K, 2/5/2020 (Revised) 8. RESPONSIBILITY REGARDING INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY.

New Clause:
The Company hereby acknowledges that it shall bear the responsibility for the ownership and protection of all Intellectual Property generated or utilized in the course of its operations, subject to the following exceptions: The Company shall not be held responsible for any Intellectual Property owned by third parties, which may be used incidentally in our operations with their express permission. Furthermore, employees, consultants, or other associates of the Company are hereby granted a non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free license to use such third-party Intellectual Property for the purpose of performing their duties for the Company, provided that they comply with all applicable terms and conditions as communicated by the third-party owner. The Company shall not assume any obligations or responsibilities towards the protection or enforcement of such third-party Intellectual Property.

original: 8.1.1 For purposes of this Agreement, “ Amorphous Alloy ” means any one or more amorphous alloys or bulk metallic glasses (or composite materials containing amorphous alloys or bulk metallic glasses) limited to the Liquidmetal Products, amorphous alloys marketed or sold under the Liquidmetal® brand, and Licensed Products.
ollama_generated:
8.1.1 For the scope of this Agreement, "Amorphous Alloy" denotes any single amorphous alloy, bulk metallic glass, or composite materials containing such, that are exclusively encompassed within the Licensed Products, the amorphous alloys commercialized or distributed under the Liquidmetal® brand, and products not specifically exempted by license.

[Explanation: This clause shifts the responsibility of defining what is not included in Amorphous Alloy (e.g., products specifically exempted by a license) from the specified alloys to those that are not part of the specified alloys.]

original: 8.1.3 “New Amorphous Alloy Technology ” means, to the extent developed or acquired after the Effective Date by a Party, alone, with the other Party or with a third party, in connection with Orders under this Agreement, the Licensed Patents, or the Licensed Technical Information, all Amorphous Alloys and/or all Intellectual Property relating to the composition, processing, properties, or applications of Amorphous Alloys, and all patents therefor, including, but not limited to, improvements to patents.
ollama_generated: 8.1.3 "New Amorphous Alloy Technology" refers to any development or acquisition, post-Effective Date, by either Party independently, jointly with the other Party, or in collaboration with a third party, of all Amorphous Alloys and/or Intellectual Property associated with their composition, processing, properties, or applications. This includes but is not limited to, enhancements, modifications, or advancements to existing patents pertaining to Amorphous Alloys. However, it is understood that the ownership of such New Amorphous Alloy Technology shall remain exclusively with the Party who originally developed or acquired it, unless otherwise agreed in writing by both Parties.

original: 8.2.1 New Alloy Technology . New Alloy Technologies that have been developed by a Party alone or with a third party shall be solely owned by the developing Party. New Alloy Technologies that have been developed by cooperation of the Parties shall be jointly and equally owned by the Parties, and any royalties for the use thereof by third parties shall be shared equitably between the Parties. The Parties shall work cooperatively toward the appropriate patent or other legal protection of such jointly and equally owned Intellectual Property.
modified: 8.2.1 Ownership of New Alloy Technologies. Any New Alloy Technology developed individually by a Party or collectively with third parties shall be exclusively owned by that developing Party. In cases where the Parties collaborate on the development, the Intellectual Property shall be jointly owned, but the responsibility for obtaining and maintaining patent or other legal protection shall primarily lie with one Party as determined mutually between the Parties. Any royalties generated from third-party use of such jointly owned Intellectual Property shall initially belong to the Party responsible for patent protection, who shall distribute these royalties equitably among the Parties.

original: 8.5 Assignment & Cooperation . To the extent that the Parties have jointly developed any New Amorphous Alloy Technology and they have agreed that such New Amorphous Alloy Technology will be jointly owned, as set forth in Section 8.2 above, each Party hereby assigns to the other, and will cause its employees, contractors, representatives, successors, assigns, Affiliates, parents, subsidiaries, officers and directors to assign to the other, a co-equal right, title and interest in and to any such jointly developed New Amorphous Alloy Technology. The parties agree to cooperate and cause their employees and contractors to cooperate in the preparation and prosecution of patent applications relating to any joint development work concerning New Process Technology or New Application Technology.
modified: 8.5 Assignment & Cooperation . If the Parties should individually or collectively develop any New Amorphous Alloy Technology, with an understanding that such technology will be solely owned by each Party as individual property, per Section 8.2 above, neither Party shall assign any rights, title, or interest in this technology to the other. However, each Party grants the other a non-exclusive, royalty-free license for the use of said technology. The parties reserve the right to independently pursue and protect their respective intellectual property rights. Concerning any joint development work on New Process Technology or New Application Technology, the parties agree not to cooperate in the preparation and prosecution of patent applications. Each Party shall ensure that its employees and contractors act accordingly.

original: “Discloser”  shall mean the Party that is disclosing Confidential Information under this Agreement, regardless of whether such Confidential Information is being provided directly by such Party, by a Representative of the Party, or by any other person that has an obligation of confidentiality with respect to the Confidential Information being disclosed. “Recipient” shall mean the Party receiving Confidential Information that is protected under this Agreement. “Representatives” shall mean the respective directors, officers, employees, financial advisors, accountants, attorneys, agents, and consultants of a Party.
ollama_generated: "Recipient" refers to the Party receiving Confidential Information safeguarded by this Agreement, irrespective of whether such information is received directly or through a Representative of the Recipient, or from any other individual bound by confidentiality obligations related to the disclosed Confidential Information. "Discloser", conversely, encompasses the Party that is divulging the Confidential Information. The term "Representatives" encompasses the respective directors, officers, employees, financial advisors, accountants, attorneys, agents, and consultants of either Party.

original: Source: LIQUIDMETAL TECHNOLOGIES INC, 8-K, 2/5/2020 10.4 Product Corrective Actions . Each Party shall immediately notify the other Party, in writing, if it becomes aware of any circumstances indicating that a stop sale, Liquidmetal Product recall, corrective action, Liquidmetal Product or quality control action or retrofit, or regulatory action involving any Liquidmetal Products sold by Eutectix to Liquidmetal or its dealers or customers (each, a “ Product Corrective Action ”) may be necessary under Laws or otherwise appropriate. Liquidmetal shall, to the extent practicable, provide to Eutectix for review any relevant data and comment upon any potential Product Corrective Action, and Liquidmetal and Eutectix will mutually decide when to conduct a Product Corrective Action and the scope of any such Product Corrective Action.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: LIQUIDMETAL TECHNOLOGIES INC, 8-K, 2/5/2020
10.4 Product Corrective Actions . Each Party shall have the discretion to determine, in its sole judgment, whether there are any circumstances indicating that a stop sale, Liquidmetal Product recall, corrective action, Liquidmetal Product or quality control action or retrofit, or regulatory action involving any Liquidmetal Products sold by Eutectix to Liquidmetal or its dealers or customers (each, a “Product Corrective Action”) may be necessary. In such case, the Party shall promptly provide the other Party with written notice of its determination and the reasons therefor. Liquidmetal shall, to the extent practicable, share any relevant data and solicit the input of Eutectix on any potential Product Corrective Action. The ultimate decision regarding when to conduct a Product Corrective Action and the scope of any such action shall be made by Liquidmetal, with consultation of Eutectix where practical.

original: 12. INSURANCE AND INDEMNIFICATION.
ollama_generated:
12. RISK MANAGEMENT AND PROTECTIVE MEASURES.

In case of any claims, losses, liabilities, or expenses arising out of or in connection with the performance of this Agreement, each Party shall endeavor to minimize such risks and potential damages. However, only the Party directly responsible for causing the loss or damage shall have the primary obligation to cover and compensate for such incident, subject to any applicable insurance coverage or indemnification agreements they may hold. In the event that one Party fails to fulfill this responsibility, the other Party reserves the right to seek reasonable recourse in a court of law or through alternative dispute resolution mechanisms.

original: 14. MISCELLANEOUS.
ollama_generated:
14. VARIOUS OBLIGATIONS AND CONTINGENCIES.

In the event of any miscellaneous issues or obligations arising out of this Agreement, Party A shall have the discretion to address such matters in a manner that it deems appropriate and reasonable, provided that it does not breach any express terms herein. Party B shall be obligated to cooperate with Party A in good faith and expedite resolution within a reasonable timeframe. In the event that no resolution is reached within a reasonable time, Party A's decision shall be final and binding.

original: 14.1 Entire Agreement . This Agreement, including its Schedules, which are attached hereto and incorporated herein, constitutes the entire understanding and agreement of the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, inducements or conditions, expressed or implied, written or oral, between the Parties relating to the subject matter hereof. No additional or different terms contained in any sales order, Quotes, acknowledgement, invoice or other communications. This Agreement shall not be changed or modified except by written agreement signed by Liquidmetal and Eutectix.
modified: 14.1 Scope of Agreement: While this Agreement, including its attached Schedules, serves as the primary framework governing our mutual understanding regarding the subject matter, it is recognized that circumstances may arise where oral or written communications not explicitly incorporated within this document may influence our relationship. Such communications shall not be considered binding unless explicitly referenced in this Agreement or formally approved by both Liquidmetal and Eutectix in a subsequent amendment, signed by duly authorized representatives of each party. This Agreement remains subject to change as per the mutual agreement of both parties in writing.

original: Notwithstanding the foregoing, this paragraph shall not preclude or limit either Party’s rights to pursue actions in the International Trade Commission, or for either Party to pursue an action with respect to a Licensed Patent before a foreign court or governmental agency if neither the federal courts nor the state courts have subject matter jurisdiction over the action. This Agreement, the legal relations between the parties, and any action, whether contractual or non-contractual, instituted by any party with respect to matters arising under or growing out of or in connection with or in respect of this Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the internal laws of the State of Arizona (U.S.A.), excluding any choice of law rules that may direct the application of the laws of another jurisdiction, and except that questions affecting the construction and effect of any Patent shall be determined by the law of the country in which the Patent has been granted. The parties agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (1980) is specifically excluded from application to this Agreement. THE PARTIES HEREBY EXPRESSLY WAIVE ANY AND ALL RIGHT TO A TRIAL BY JURY WITH RESPECT TO ANY ACTION, PROCEEDING OR OTHER LITIGATION RESULTING FROM OR INVOLVING THE ENFORCEMENT OF THIS AGREEMENT.
modified:
Notwithstanding the preceding provisions, neither Party shall be prohibited or constrained from exercising their right to instigate proceedings related to the International Trade Commission. Furthermore, either Party retains the prerogative to initiate legal actions concerning a Licensed Patent before foreign courts or administrative bodies, should it be determined that neither federal nor state courts possess jurisdiction over the matter at hand.

This Agreement, all associated relationships between the parties, and any claim, whether based on contractual obligations or not, initiated by either party in relation to matters stemming from, connected with, or arising under this Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted under the domestic laws of Arizona, U.S.A., disregarding any legal principles that might suggest the application of legislation from another jurisdiction. However, matters concerning the interpretation and impact of any Patent shall be decided in accordance with the law of the country where the patent has been issued. The parties acknowledge and agree to the exclusion of the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods (1980) from the scope of this Agreement.

Lastly, the Parties hereby relinquish any and all entitlement to a jury trial in relation to any dispute, lawsuit, or litigation arising from or involving the enforcement of this Agreement.

original: (a) Workers’ Compensation and Employers’ Liability insurance with limits to conform with the greater of the amount required by applicable law or one million dollars ($1,000,000) each accident, including occupational disease coverage and an endorsement to the Workers’ Compensation and Employers’ Liability insurance policy, in form acceptable to Liquidmetal, containing a waiver of subrogation by the insurance carrier with respect to Liquidmetal and its parent, subsidiaries, divisions and Affiliates, and all of their respective directors, officers, shareholders, employees and representatives; (b) Commercial General Liability insurance with limits of not less than five million dollars ($5,000,000) combined single limit for bodily injury, death, and property damage, including personal injury, contractual liability, independent contractors, broad- form property damage, and products and completed operations coverage; and, (c) Commercial Automobile Liability insurance with limits of not less than one million dollars ($1,000,000) each occurrence combined single limit of liability for bodily injury, death, and property damage, including owned and non-owned and hired automobile coverages, as applicable.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Company shall maintain Workers' Compensation and Employers' Liability insurance with coverage limits that meet the greater of the amount required by law or one million dollars ($1,000,000), per incident, encompassing occupational disease coverage. Additionally, this policy should include an endorsement waiving the subrogation rights of the insurance carrier regarding Liquidmetal, its parent companies, subsidiaries, divisions, and Affiliates, as well as all their respective directors, officers, shareholders, employees, and representatives. This waiver applies to any claims arising from such parties.

(b) The Company shall secure Commercial General Liability insurance with a minimum coverage of five million dollars ($5,000,000), on a combined single limit basis, for bodily injury, death, property damage, personal injury, contractual liability, and claims involving independent contractors. This policy should also include broad-form property damage coverage, as well as products and completed operations protection.

(c) For Commercial Automobile Liability insurance, the Company shall ensure a minimum coverage of one million dollars ($1,000,000), per occurrence, with a combined single limit for bodily injury, death, and property damage. This policy should cover both owned vehicles and non-owned automobiles, as well as hired vehicles when applicable.
